snippet: A Nielsen study affirmed the idea that Twitter chatter during prime-time shows can sometimes cause a “significant increase” in the ratings.
abstract: Nielsen study finds Twitter chatter during prime-time television shows on major networks causes 'significant increase' in ratings 29 percent of time; some genres of shows are much more likely to benefit from Twitter conversation than others.
lead_paragraph: A Nielsen study affirmed the idea that Twitter chatter during prime-time shows can sometimes cause a “significant increase” in the ratings.

headline.main: Study Links TV Viewership and Twitter Conversations
headline.print_headline: Study Links TV Viewership And Twitter Conversations
